thread.title: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho takes swipe at Arsene Wenger: "I behave on the bench... not sent off"
thread.title_full: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho takes swipe at Arsene Wenger: "I behave on the bench... not sent off"

author: Rory Brigstock-Barron
title: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho takes swipe at Arsene Wenger: "I behave on the bench... not sent off"
text:
Jose Mourinho refused to comment on his side's performance against Hull, instead comparing himself to Arsene Wenger (Photo: Gareth Copley) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jose Mourinho channeled his frustration into a dig at Arsene Wenger on Thursday night after watching his Manchester United side end their 17-game unbeaten run with a 2-1 defeat at Hull. 
Referee Jon Moss awarded Hull a dubious first-half penalty in the game at the KCOM stadium, which saw United advance to the EFL Cup final despite defeat thanks to a 2-0 win in the first leg at Old Trafford. 
And while Mourinho congratulated his players on reaching the final, the main focus of his short post-match interview was his own performance on the bench. Referee Jon Moss handed Hull a dubious penalty in the first half which gave the home side the lead (Photo: Man Utd via Getty Images) Tom Huddlestone tucked away the spot kick (Photo: REUTERS) 
"I just want to say congratulations to my players because it was a difficult to [get] in the final, and we are in the final," Mourinho, who was celebrating his 54th birthday, told Sky Sports. 
"I don't want to say anything else because it's enough. I'm calm, I behaved on the bench, not sent off, no punishment, so no more words," he added before storming off. Arsene Wenger was sent off for protesting against a penalty given by Moss on Sunday (Photo: PA) 
Arsenal boss Wenger was sent to the stands by Moss for his reaction to a late penalty awarded to Burnley at the Emirates Stadium on Sunday. 
Mourinho has often landed himself in hot water for his post-match comments, and his succinct comments were perhaps aimed at avoiding talking about Jonathan Moss's performance, as well as that of his own side. 
United will play Southampton in the EFL Cup final on February 26 after the Saints bested Liverpool. poll loading Would Jose Mourinho have received greater criticism if he acted like Arsene Wenger against Burnley? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
